reviews.text: Phevos Villa offers one of the nicest pools (in this price range or higher) in Perissa Beach -- sparkling water, luxurious padded deck chairs and nice setting next to the rocky mountain.
reviews.title: Spotlessly clean, great pool, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are similarly spotless and offer a nice small kitchenette. I'm surprised by those complaining the rooms are 'small' or inadequately furnished -- for a two-star hotel, they are more than adequate and have a nice, simple Greek style. Wood furnishings were actually a bit nicer than I expected.
reviews.title: Two star accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is about 200 meters from the beach (5 minute walk) and another five minutes to bars, restaurants and bakeries on the main road.
reviews.title: Relaxing Holiday

reviews.text: We weren't charged 6 euros for the a/c (it seemed to be included), but didn't use it at all anyway. Better to enjoy the fresh island air.
reviews.title: absolutely fab island
Great holiday
reviews.text: One great feature of this hotel (and that others would do well to emulate in Perissa) is that departing guests are allowed to store their bags in a proper bedroom with complete shower and toilet facilities -- the incredibly gracious maid even brought us a set of clean towels for showering later in the day when we dropped off our bags.

Just returned from two weeks at the Phevos. First the Hotel. Even in August there were plenty of sunbeds at any time of the day. Sunbeds were very comfortable. The pool is clean and unheated but in 40 degrees of heat the water certainly isn't cold. There is a deep end which is a change from the norm but the shallow end is safe for children. The food served at the pool bar was limited but tasty and good value. The rooms are small and I do mean small. However they are spotlessly clean. They are cleaned with fresh linen and towels every day. Maria the cleaner doesn't stop. Also you are supplied with loads of toilet rolls, hand soap, washing up liquid and a clean tea towel every day. Each apartment has its own outside sitting area and washing line with pegs. Air conditioning is 6 euros a day and the safe is attached to the wall and free.
reviews.title: Far from Abysmal - ~Brilliant

reviews.text: George and Anna are lovely as is Jacob who helps out too. Nothing is too much trouble. However you do have to make the effort with them. They will leave you alone if you prefer but if you want to sit and chat they are happy to do so. We spent many a night with a carafe of red chatting to them. They are charming hosts. The barbeque wasn't on when we were there due to lack of interest which was a shame. George and Anna have two dogs and a cat that has five kittens. They are all friendly and well looked after. When we were there the guests loved the animals and there was no barking at night.
reviews.title: Phevos Villa, Perissa

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is superb. A couple of minutes from the local shop and bakery or alternatively about a ten minute walk to the larger co-op which will give you a lift back to you hotel with your shopping if you ask. Again a couple of minutes walk to the beach and tavernas. The sea is gorgeous but the volcanic beach is black and gets very very hot. You will need shoes to walk on the sand/grit! Loads of places to eat along the front. From the end by the mountain please try the very small italian. Fresh food cooked as you arrive. It is delicious. Further along is a pizza restaurant which again is brilliant. Fish restaurant wasn't great. On the main street which runs just behind the beach try Cyclades (the only place we got vegetables) and Scirocco. Both excellent food. Local bus to Thira is 2 euros and ends in Perissa so you can't get lost. Change at Thira for Oia, Kamari etc.. They run until about 1am.
reviews.title: Don't believe the hype!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely holiday and if we wanted to return to Santorini we would have no hesitation in staying here again. Don't be put off by negative reviews this really us a little gem.
reviews.title: brilliant villa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel, friendly hosts and quiet location on the back street at the mountain end of Perissa.
reviews.title: Absolutley fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lovely place to stay. George and Anna are great hosts and very friendly. We spent many an evening after being out for a meal sitting at the pool bar with George and other guests and we had a great laugh and felt very relaxed. We have been to Santorini several times but Phevos is by far the best, we could not fault it. We stayed june 2012 for 2 weeks. We would recommend Phevos if you stay in Perissa and will be going back next year.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited Santorini for the first time last year for our daughters wedding, and our stay at Phevos could not have been better. Great location, near to the beach, and Georgio and his wife Anna were two of the nicest people you could ever wish to meet.Pool area and sunbeds must be the best in Perissa and the fact that it is often fully booked speaks for itself.Have just returned from our two week stay again at Phevos and despite only being back 3 weeks, we have, along with friends we made, have already booked for 2013!!
reviews.title: Brilliant Holiday

reviews.text: With best wishes and many thanks to Georgio and Anna
reviews.title: A little Greek gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking forward to seeing you on 11/06/2013
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: Stayed here on our return visit to Santorini in june for 2 weeks .We read reviews beforehand on TA and decided to keep an open mind ,as some of the comments are totally unjustified.Firstly the rooms are basic but they are the cleanest rooms i have ever found in self caterering appts anywhere (my dettox wipes never even got opened ,and thats a first!!) .Maria the maid is a marvel ,towels,bedding and floor are cleaned every day and she even did some washing up for us !! Tea towels are provided along with washing up liquid and sponge and also handwash in the bathroom ,which smells lovely .The pool area is perfect with good quality beds with foam cushions (not what you would expect from a 2 star) ,pool was cleaned every morning by Georgios before he went to work at his main job .Bar area serves hot and cold drinks and light meals ,the Greek salad using Georgios home grown tomatoes and cucumber was the best i tasted in all Santorini !!! the frappe coffees are lovely too.I think the fact that this hotel is run by a lovely Greek family only adds to the experience ,make time to talk to Georgios ,Anna and Jacob who like nothing more than having a chat over a glass of Georgios special wine on a night time.If you are lucky enough to sample one of there Greek nights round the pool its money well spent ,it costs 10 euros per person for unlimited barbequed meats ,salads ,potatoes .. the list goes on ,and also live Greek bouzouki music ,well worth the money i would even go as far as to say they need to charge a little more .Room 4 is a lovely triple family room on the ground floor ,overlooking the pool with a nice little terrace of your own .Thanks again Georgios ,Anna & Jacob for welcoming us into your lovely hotel ,and Anna hope you are practising those Mojitos hahhaha ,hope to see you again .xx
reviews.title: Fabulous phevos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only say that anything you have read about this place which was negative, either through this site or any other is complete rubbish. I really don't want to write this, as I would like to keep this place exclusive and be able to book it at will, but that wouldn't be fair to the owners.
reviews.title: Santorini's Gem

reviews.text: Georgios and Anna (and young Jacob) are probably the warmest hosts that you could imagine, but you need to bear in mind that this is a family business and not a corporate set up and a little consideration for their finances is needed (ie. spend a bit of cash at the pool bar - Georgios home made wine is worth every cent).
reviews.title: Great Base!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spotlessly clean, as is the pool itself, and all the surrounding areas. Maria, the cleaner carries out her work with respect to the guests and there is fresh linen and bedding every day.
reviews.title: Perfect place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a base for exploring the island it could not be more ideally located. Sat at the foot of the highest mountain on the island, you have the options of hiring a quad bike or car and are fairly central for discovering all the of the island or staying local and walking, scrambling, or serious rock climbing in the area.
reviews.title: Almost perfect...just one step away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all an absolutely superb place to stay and relax.
reviews.title: OK.... but only just
